greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle, read by rows, where row n equals the inverse binomial of column n of square array A100324, which lists the self-convolutions of SHIFT(A003169).
comment: The leftmost column equals A003169 shift one place right.
Each column k>0 equals the convolution of the prior column and A003169.
The elements of the matrix inverse are T^(-1)(n,k) = (-1)^(n+k) * A158687(n,k). - _R. J. Mathar_, Mar 15 2013
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 0..120 of triangle, flattened
formula: G.f.: A(x, y) = (1 + G(x))/(1 - y*G(x)), where G(x) is the g.f. of A003169.
example: All other elements are from the convolution of prior column and A003169:
First column forms A003169 shift right.
Binomial transform of row 3 forms column 3 of square A100324:
Binomial transform of row 4 forms column 4 of square A100324:
maple: if k < 0 or k > n then
mathematica: lim = 9; t[0, 0] = 1; t[n_, 0] := t[n, 0] = Sum[(k + 1)*t[n - 1, k], {k, 0, n - 1}]; t[n_, k_] := t[n, k] = Sum[t[j + 1, 0]*t[n - j - 1, k - 1], {j, 0, n - k}]; Flatten[ Table[ t[n, k], {n, 0, lim}, {k, 0, n}]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 20 2011 *)
program: f xss@(xs:_) = ys : f (ys : xss) where
ys = y : map (sum . zipWith (*) (zs ++ [y])) (map reverse zss)
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Nov 17 2004
